DataElement.preferredName: Vial Or Syringe Volume Measurement Size Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the vial or syringe volume measurement size type.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vial Or Syringe Volume Measurement Size
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A small, often stoppered glass or plastic bottle for holding fluids._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A device for the administration of drug products that consists of a rigid barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate._The determination of the volume of a sample._The physical magnitude of something.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A device for the administration of drug products that consists of a rigid barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0.8: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.: A device for the administration of drug products that consists of a rigid barrel fitted with septum with a plunger at one end and a seal or needle at the other end. The needle assembly may be part of the device or separate.
